projects.name: Diabeatit
projects.title: Diabeatit
projects.description: Android app that teaches kids about healthy eating.
projects.desc: Diabeatit is a health education Android application that teaches kids about the importance of healthy eating in order to reduce the risk of developing type-two diabetes. Diabeatit is in its early stages. It currently has three working mini games that encourage healthy food decisions.

info.title: Role
info.content: Worked on the development of the 'Shooter' game and fixed bugs with user interface throughout the app.

info.title: Links
info.content: Diabeatit Page Global Ties

projects.name: LWCMP
projects.title: LWCMPT
projects.desc: The Live Well Community Market Program Tool (LWCMPT) is a web application that helped the Live Well Community Market Program collect data and visualize it using graphs and charts. The Program is from the UC San Diego School Medicine. It aims to promote and improve access to affordable healthy food in San Diego County. The Program works with small neighborhood markets across San Diego to redesign their markets to have easier access to fresher foods. The LWCMPT facilitated the work the Program had to do by placing all of the markets’ data in a web application that can be accessed and changed on any modern phone or computer.

info.title: Role
info.content: Worked with the back-end and front-end development team to implement the login authentication and database structuring. Also worked on user testing and user research.

info.title: Development Tools
info.content: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js(Express + Handlebars + Passport)

info.title: Links

projects.name: NueroViz
projects.title: NueroViz
projects.description: Web app that tracks students’ study habits and dipsplays it to user.
projects.desc: NueroViz is a prototype application that helps students track their studying habits based on the time spent on each subject. The application displays the student’s time distribution using graphs. The application was built to remind people that having observable data of their studies can help users develop smarter and better informed study habits.

info.title: Role
info.content: Led development of database and server. Fixed bugs found throughout the app. Contributed to front-end development and design.

info.title: Links

projects.name: Research
projects.title: Research
projects.desc: The primary research goal of the Vision and Memory Lab at UCSD is to try to “understand how visual information is represented by the visual system and how it is encoded and integrated into memory.” The project I worked on looked at the effects of proactive interference on object binding to better understand visual short-term memory . The project was built on MATLAB. The entire team worked together to design the objects (shapes) using Psychtoolbox, to write functions to get user input and classify each input based on binding or interference, and finally to design a function to analyze the data.

info.title: Role
info.content: Contributed to the development and design of the research project as envisioned by the researcher.
